etymology.description: pictogram: a vertical wooden stick; appears in early 朕 (originally “to mend a boat”) and in 尹, where the stick symbolizes authority.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an upright staff, emphasizing straightness and verticality. Its use inside graphs like 朕 and 尹 shows it originally pictured a tool or staff and later generalized to the basic vertical stroke.

examples.chinese: 汉字的第二号部首是丨(漢字的第二號部首是丨)。
examples.pinyin: Hànzì de dì-èr hào bùshǒu shì gǔn.
examples.english: The second Chinese radical is 丨.

examples.chinese: 写字时，要把这一笔丨写直(寫字時，要把這一筆丨寫直)。
examples.pinyin: Xiězì shí, yào bǎ zhè yì bǐ gǔn xiě zhí.
examples.english: When writing, this stroke 丨 should be written straight.

examples.chinese: 他写了一笔丨(他寫了一筆丨)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiě le yì bǐ gǔn.
examples.english: He wrote a single vertical stroke.
